required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Three Birds With One Stone: a Randomised Intervention Study to Increase Participation in Cervical and Colorectal Cancer Screening Using Breast Cancer Screening as a Leverage

brief_summary.textblock: The overall aim of the study is to increase participation rates in cervical cancer (CCU) and colorectal cancer (CRC) screening programmes in Denmark by offering home-based CCU and CRC screening when attending breast cancer screening to women who are not up to date with one or both screening programmes.

detailed_description.textblock:
A cluster randomised public health trial will take place in Central Denmark Region (CDR) targeting women attending breast cancer screening. Five breast cancer screening units serve women five days a week, and all five units will be included in the study and randomised to an equal amount of intervention days. On the intervention days, the other four units will serve as control group, providing a randomisation ratio of 1:4.
On intervention days, a research assistant will ask women aged 50-69 if they are interested in having a check up on their screening status in CCU and CRC screening. If she has not participated timely, she will be offered to receive a test-kit corresponding to CRC screening and/or to receive a self-sample device for CCU screening (or reminded to call her general practitioner (GP) to have a conventional cervical cytology sample taken).
If the woman accepts a self-sample kit for CCU and/or CRC screening, she will receive it by mail together with written instructions, picturebased user instructions, information on national recommendation for cancer screening and a pre-paid, pre-addressed envelope for returning the sample to the laboratory.
The result of the test will be sent to the women by digital mail as well as passed on to her GP.
Clinical management in case of a positive test result will follow national guidelines corresponding to CCU and CRC screening programmes.
Women in the control group will receive standard screening offers according to the national screening programmes.
All women entering a breast cancer screening unit in CDR on a intervention day (intervention + control units) will be sent a survey asking their experience with breast cancer screening a few days after breast cancer screening. The women in the intervention group will be asked about the acceptability of the intervention as well.
6250 women must be included, of which 1250 women will be in the intervention group for CCU and CRC screening, respectively.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference between intervention and control group in proportion of women participating in CCU and CRC screening after 90 days
primary_outcome.time_frame: 90 days after participating in breast cancer screening

primary_outcome.measure: Difference between intervention and control group in proportion of women participating in CCU and CRC screening after 180 days
primary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days after participating in breast cancer screening

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of hrHPV in self-samples in CCU screening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After study completion, expected to be 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of compliance to follow-up in CCU screening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 30, 90, 180 days after a positive hrHPV self-sample
secondary_outcome.description: A GP collected sample after a hrHPV positive self-sample

secondary_outcome.measure: Register-based screening history of self-samplers in CCU screening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After test completion. expected to be 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of hrHPV in the GP collected cervical triage sample among hrHPV positive selfsamplers after CCU screening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After test completion, expected to be 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of colposcopies after CCU screening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 180 days after a positive hrHPV self-sample
Within 180 days after a positive hrHPV self-sample

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of hrHPV positive cases in women 60-64 years after 12 months with an initial negative hrHPV sample in CCU screening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After test completion, expected to be 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of positive FIT cases after CRC screening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After test completion, expected to be 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Histology (number of adenomas, dysplasia, cancer) after a positive FIT in CRC screening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After test completion, expected to be 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Register-based screening history in CRC screening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After test completion, expected to be 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of compliance to follow-up with colonoscopy after a positive FIT

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of women accepting a check up on CCU and CRC screening status
other_outcome.description: Process outcome within the intervention group

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of women not being up-to-date with CCU and/or CRC screening
other_outcome.description: Process outcome within the intervention group

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of women accepting a test-kit
other_outcome.description: Process outcome within the intervention group

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of women not returning a test kit
other_outcome.description: Process outcome within the intervention group

other_outcome.measure: Previous screening history, previous cancer diagnoses, socioeconomic data (age, ethnicity, marital status, educational status) and inflammatory bowel disease
other_outcome.description: To test if the randomisation succeeded
Evaluation regarding the acceptability of the intervention

arm_group.arm_group_label: Intervention group, women not up to date in CCU screening
arm_group.description: Women aged 50-64 years, who have not had a cervical cytology sample taken within 5 years and 6 months will be offered to receive a self-sample device for high risk human papilloma virus (hrHPV) screening by mail, or reminded to see her general practitioner (GP) to have a conventional cervical cytology sample taken.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Intervention group, women not up to date in CRC screening
arm_group.description: Women aged 50-69 years, who have not had a Faecal Immunochemical Test (FIT) within 2 years and 4.5 months will be offered to receive a new self-sampling kit for FIT.
Women in the control group will receive standard screening offers according to the national screening programme.

intervention.description: Women are offered check-up on screening status in both CCU and CRC screening. If a woman is not up to date in one or both screening programmes, she will be offered a self-sampling device and/or a FIT kit.
intervention.arm_group_label: Intervention group, women not up to date in CCU screening
Intervention group, women not up to date in CRC screening

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- In CCU screening: women aged 50-64 years entering a breast cancer screening unit on intervention days without CCU screening within the last 5 years and 6 months
- In CRC screening: women aged 50-69 years entering a breast cancer screening unit on intervention days without CRC screening within the last 2 years and 4.5 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- In CRC screening: if a women has not yet received the first invitation in the CRC screening programme

overall_official.last_name: Berit Andersen, Prof., MD, Head of Department
overall_official.affiliation: Department of Public Health Programmes and University Clinic for Cancer Screening, Randers Regional Hospital and Department of Clinical Medicine, Aarhus University
